es.utils.functionalinterfaces.throwing

Interface ConsumerX<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - type of the element to consume
    All Superinterfaces:
    Consumer<T>, Serializable
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface ConsumerX<T>
extends Consumer<T>, Serializable
    A sub-class of Consumer that handle the exceptions.
    Author:
    eschoysman

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • accept

        default void accept(T elem)
        Try to call the acceptThrows(elem) method. If any error occurs, throws a RuntimeException.
        Specified by:
        accept in interface Consumer<T>

      • accept

        default <E extends Exception> void accept(T elem,
                                          Function<Throwable,E> function)
                                   throws E extends Exception
        Try to call the #acceptThrows(Object) method. If any error occurs, throws the exception returned by the provided function.
        Type Parameters:
        E - the type of Exception to throw
        Parameters:
        elem - the element to consume
        function - a function that takes a Throwable as input and returns an Exception to throw.
        Throws:
        E - if the body of this function throws an exception
        E extends Exception

      • acceptThrows

        void acceptThrows(T elem)
           throws Exception
        The body of the ConsumerX instance
        Parameters:
        elem - the object to be consumed
        Throws:
        Exception - allow the implementation to throw any kind of exception
